course_title: Spec. Topics In Political Science: Southern Politics
class_notes:
(Permission of Instructor Required Prior to Enrollment)


The South is the most American America where all the issues we face in American politics are laid bare, and the most intractable problems, which are often subtext in other regions, are headlines.  As they say: "Here in the South, we don't hide crazy; we parade it on the front porch and give it a cocktail."  This course aims to better understand the unique politics of the fastest-growing region of the United States - home to about one in three Americans - and to better understand American politics as a whole and the world around us.  In this course, we will seek to understand how race, class, economics, immigration, and religion all had a hand in shaping the landscape of Southern and American politics.  By the end of this class, you will hopefully develop a deep sense of understanding and appreciation for this often maligned region and its people.
course_description: May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Seminar and/or advanced class in selected political science topics. Primarily for students interested in politics.
